briefing.opening: Good morning/afternoon. Welcome to the climate briefing for January 20, 2026.

sections.title: ğŸ”´ Deepening Climate Crisis: Ecosystem Disruption and Visible Economic Losses
sections.content: Today's announcements warn that the impacts of climate change on our society and ecosystems are intensifying. Domestically, tangerine productivity in the Jeju region has plummeted by 9% [1], and the social costs of the climate crisis are projected to double when reflecting marine ecosystem damage, signaling severe economic repercussions [5]. Notably, both domestically and internationally, the breeding season for penguins has shifted earlier by up to 2 weeks to 13 days, causing ecological disruption and even raising concerns that they may attack each other [2, 6, 8, 54, 61, 72, 94, 95, 96]. Furthermore, a UN report indicates that the world has entered an era of 'global water bankruptcy,' harming billions of people [98], and warnings have emerged that biodiversity collapse could lead to food shortages and mass migration, threatening UK security [97, 100].

sections.title: ğŸŒ± Accelerating Domestic Carbon Neutrality and Renewable Energy Transition Efforts
sections.content: Amidst these crises, positive movements towards achieving carbon neutrality and transitioning to renewable energy are active both domestically and internationally. SK Square has demonstrated its ESG performance by achieving the highest rating, 'Leadership A,' in the CDP Climate Change Response assessment [9]. Various local governments, including the Ansan Environmental Foundation, Yangpyeong County, and Yecheon County, are actively promoting environmental education and policies to achieve carbon neutrality [11, 12, 13, 14, 19, 23, 24, 28, 30]. Furthermore, Korea Hydro & Nuclear Power (KHNP) is contributing to the 'Jeju 2035 Carbon Neutrality' goal through collaboration with Jeju National University on green hydrogen commercialization [27], and the Ministry of Trade, Industry and Energy plans to introduce an auction system for 'Carbon Neutrality Projects,' providing up to 5 billion won per company [21]. In the renewable energy sector, Hyundai Engineering & Construction is leading the achievement of K-RE100 by securing a 1.5 GW renewable energy supply chain through an agreement with Topsolar [31, 32], and the Korean government is also operating a comprehensive support system, including finance and technology, to achieve RE100 and expand renewable energy [43].

sections.title: ğŸ‡°ğŸ‡· Reviewing the Implementation and Challenges of Climate Policies
sections.content: Alongside efforts to achieve carbon neutrality goals, challenges in reviewing and supplementing the implementation of domestic climate policies are also emerging. North Chungcheong Province is actively reviewing its carbon neutrality implementation, checking the progress of 156 tasks [25, 29]. It has also been pointed out that while major countries have entered the 'implementation phase' of carbon neutrality, Korea's carbon neutrality efforts are concentrated in manufacturing sectors such as mobility [17]. Notably, 4 out of 10 Korean companies participating in RE100 reported difficulties in procuring renewable energy [38], indicating an urgent need to expand renewable energy supply and improve the procurement environment. Meanwhile, Seoul's incentive for easing floor area ratio for electric vehicle charging station installations during urban regeneration redevelopment projects is set to be abolished after three years of its introduction [53], suggesting a need to reconsider the consistency and support measures for eco-friendly transition policies.

sections.title: ğŸŒ International Community's Response to Climate Change and Complex Crises
sections.content: The international community is also grappling with various aspects of climate change. New research in the Sahel region has revealed that climate change response efforts are, in fact, exacerbating conflicts [56, 66], demonstrating the importance of considering social and geopolitical contexts when formulating climate policies. In New Jersey and Virginia, USA, bills mandating climate change education in public higher education curricula have been reintroduced [57, 63], continuing efforts to raise climate awareness among future generations. The Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation is supporting a pilot program to enhance climate change management capabilities for East African coffee farmers through Helios AI [77], and the NIHR (National Institute for Health and Care Research) is working to help health and social care services adapt to climate change [92], striving to develop practical adaptation and support measures. Furthermore, news that China's thermal power generation has decreased for the first time in 10 years, with the expansion of renewable energy creating a structural shift [35], is interpreted as a positive signal for global energy transition efforts.

briefing.closing: Today's briefing has once again highlighted the severity of the climate crisis, while also clearly demonstrating the various response efforts underway both domestically and internationally, alongside the challenges that still need to be addressed. This is a time that calls for sustained attention and action. This concludes today's climate briefing.
